alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 02 at 1:42PM MDT until April 04 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM UNTIL 8 PM TODAY FOR THE NORTHEAST AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS AS WELL AS THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM MONDAY FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN AND WESTERN NM BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM MONDAY TO 9 PM TUESDAY FOR ALL OF EASTERN NM DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE AND POOR HUMIDITY RECOVERY... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM TUESDAY FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND THE SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .An extended period of critical fire weather will impact much of the region through Tuesday. The focus will be across eastern NM today before spreading to the entire region Monday. Critical fire weather will persist through Monday night into Tuesday across all of eastern New Mexico and redevelop over parts of central NM by Tuesday afternoon. Winds will finally taper off Tuesday night with very cold temperatures and higher humidity to alleviate critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM MONDAY TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 9 AM Monday to 9 PM MDT Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Northeast Plains (Zone 104), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123), Central Highlands (Zone 125), and East Central Plains (Zone 126) until 8 PM today then again from 9 am Monday to 9 pm Tuesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West-southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph today. Southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph Monday. West winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values 8 to 12 percent today, then 5 to 12 percent Monday and Tuesday. Several hours of single digit relative humidity values are likely each day with very little humidity recovery Monday night. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains
